channel.title: Private server websites
channel.description:
Well my exams have finished, and I will now have quite some free time and I'm going to use some of this time to create website templates for Runescape private servers, mainly because this is one of the forums I visit the most and I want to brush up on my designing.
What I am looking for is what you as a player of a private server or someone who runs servers, what would you expect to see on a private server website (content or layout wise). Anything that contributes to this topic would be grateful, just a few words to a few paragraphs would be appreciated.

item.title: Private server websites
item.dc:creator: @Wintercanon Wintercanon
item.description:
@Wintercanon wrote:

[quote=“RuneSpace, post:1, topic:378202”]Like this?

http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,471472.0.html[/quote]No PSC is a complete framework combining both a gameserver and community driven web system. It integrates a gameserver, highscores, forums and content management in one.

I believe what cane wants to do is design a HTML/CSS and possible JS (jQuery) driven template that people can build their own website backends to.

Edit: cane, a not too wide layout as the website won’t be packed with articles like a blog. I think it should have a news image slider at the top for latest news. I liked the little transparent black box on the Runescape website header that indicated number of players currently online and the account you are logged into. For colors, I think gold, brown, grey and yellow for Runescape private servers. I think noisy and stone textured backgrounds also suit it well.

Read full topic
